meanings.definition: The cutting blade of a plow.
meanings.sent1: The farmer sharpened the plowshare before starting to work.
meanings.sent2: The old plowshare was replaced with a new one for better efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The plowshare decided to take a break from all the cutting and enjoy the view.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as sharp as a plowshare, cutting through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the plowshare in the sunlight made it look like a silver sword.

meanings.definition: A tool used for cutting and turning over soil in preparation for planting.
meanings.sent1: The farmer's most important tool was the trusty plowshare.
meanings.sent2: She carefully cleaned the plowshare after each use to prevent rust.
meanings.sent3: The plowshare and the shovel had a friendly competition on who could dig faster.
meanings.sent4: The plowshare sliced through the earth like a knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the plowshare in his hands gave him a sense of purpose and strength.

meanings.definition: To use a plowshare to till the land.
meanings.sent1: The farmer will plowshare the field tomorrow to prepare for planting.
meanings.sent2: She plowshares the land with precision and care, ensuring even distribution.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to plowshare the backyard, imagining they were farmers.
meanings.sent4: His determination to plowshare the rocky soil showed his dedication to farming.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the plowshare against the earth was music to his ears.
